metadata.name: Query
metadata.description:
Build a Query object.

Queries should be built with and run via .

Reference: {@link http://goo.gl/Cag0r6}

metadata.name: filter
metadata.description:
Datastore allows querying on properties. Supported comparison operators are =, <, >, <=, and >=. "Not equal" and IN operators are currently not supported.

To filter by ancestors, see .

Reference: {@link http://goo.gl/ENCx7e}

metadata.name: order
metadata.description:
Sort the results by a property name ascendingly or descendingly. By default, an ascending sort order will be used.

Reference: {@link http://goo.gl/mfegFR}

params.name: property
params.description: - Optional operator (+, -) and property to order by.

metadata.name: groupBy
metadata.description: Group query results by a list of properties.

metadata.name: select
metadata.description:
Retrieve only select properties from the matched entities.

Reference: Projection Queries">http://goo.gl/EfsrJl}

examples.code:
// Only retrieve the name and size properties.
var selectQuery = companyQuery.select(['name', 'size']);

params.name: fieldNames
params.description: - Properties to return from the matched entities.

metadata.name: start
metadata.description:
Set a starting cursor to a query.

Reference: {@link http://goo.gl/WuTGRI}

metadata.name: end
metadata.description:
Set an ending cursor to a query.

Reference: {@link http://goo.gl/WuTGRI}

examples.code:
// Limit the results to 10 entities.
var limitQuery = companyQuery.limit(10);

params.name: n
params.description: - The number of results to limit the query to.

examples.code:
// Start from the 101st result.
var offsetQuery = companyQuery.offset(100);

params.name: n
params.description: - The offset to start from after the start cursor.
